Classes/CachableManager/Storage/CacheDir.name: documents
Classes/CachableManager/Storage/CacheDir.abstract: Should be used only for data that is user generated and can’t be retrieved from server. These will be sync with iCloud.

Classes/CachableManager/Storage/CacheDir.name: caches
Classes/CachableManager/Storage/CacheDir.abstract: Should be used for anything that can be retrieved from server. This directory can be wiped clean from Apple at anytime.

Classes/CachableManager/Storage/CacheDir.name: url
Classes/CachableManager/Storage/CacheDir.abstract: Returns the specified path url for the directory

Classes/CachableManager/Storage.html#/s:.name: removeAllCache()
Classes/CachableManager/Storage.html#/s:.abstract: Removes all cached items, from both documents and cache directories

Classes/CachableManager/Storage.html#/s:.name: removeExpiredCache()
Classes/CachableManager/Storage.html#/s:.abstract: Removes only expired cached items; This will not allow you to use them for offline mode

Classes/CachableManager/Storage/CacheDir.name: CacheDirectory
Classes/CachableManager/Storage/CacheDir.abstract: Directory used by Cachable to store data to disk

Classes/CachableManager/Network.html#/s:.name: startMonitoring()
Classes/CachableManager/Network.html#/s:.abstract: Start monitor for network changes; Does not take in to account weak signal. Does not check Reachability / signal strength

Classes/CachableManager/Logger.html#/s:8.name: debug
Classes/CachableManager/Logger.html#/s:8.abstract: set to true to see all debug print statements

Classes/CachableManager/CacheStatus.html.name: cached
Classes/CachableManager/CacheStatus.html.abstract: Data from non-expired cache result if not in offline mode; other wise could be from expired cache.

Classes/CachableManager/CacheStatus.html.name: none
Classes/CachableManager/CacheStatus.html.abstract: Something went wrong, there are no results so no status either

Classes/CachableManager.html#/s:8Cachabl.name: isOfflineModeEnabled
Classes/CachableManager.html#/s:8Cachabl.abstract: return whether or not Cachable is working in offline mode

Classes/CachableManager.html#/s:8Cachabl.name: setOfflineMode(enabled:)
Classes/CachableManager.html#/s:8Cachabl.abstract: Enabling offline mode will return cached data even if it’s expired.

Classes/CachableManager/CacheStatus.html.name: CacheStatus
Classes/CachableManager/CacheStatus.html.abstract: Determines how/where the data was reterived from

Classes/Cachable.html#/s:8CachableAAC8ca.name: cacheKey
Classes/Cachable.html#/s:8CachableAAC8ca.abstract: Used as primary key to reterieve data as well as the file name that will be stored on disk for caching

Classes/Cachable.html#/s:8CachableAAC14e.name: expireDuration
Classes/Cachable.html#/s:8CachableAAC14e.abstract: Number of seconds this object should expire after.

Classes/Cachable.html#/s:8CachableAACABy.name: init()
Classes/Cachable.html#/s:8CachableAACABy.abstract: Keeps the expireDuration in sync with the cacheRecord for this item.

Classes/Cachable.html#/s:8CachableAAC5fe.name: fetch(completion:)
Classes/Cachable.html#/s:8CachableAAC5fe.abstract: Used to reterive data for this cachable item. If this is a cachable API, your URLRequest would go here. Make sure to call the completion handler when ready.

Classes/Cachable.html.name: Cachable
Classes/Cachable.html.abstract: Create a Cachable object from any object that conforms to Codable.
